title: How to Make Curried Lentils

steps.headline: Rinse the lentils under running water.
steps.description: It's easiest if you do this in a colander or sieve. Remove any small stones or debris.

steps.headline: Pour the stock or water into a large saucepan or pot.
steps.description: Add the lentils and salt. Bring to a boil.

steps.headline: Sauté the onions in the olive oil in a frying pan.
steps.description: Add the curry and garlic powder (or finely chopped garlic). Cook until the onions become tender and then add them to the boiling lentils.

steps.headline: Keep cooking the lentils for another hour or so.
steps.description: More liquid can be added as needed, either more stock or water (add 1/2 cup at a time and add more if needed).

steps.headline: Remove from the heat.
steps.description: The lentils will be a more yellow or golden color owing to the curry.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description:
The curried lentils can be served as they are as part of a side accompaniment or even as a curried lentil mains for a vegetarian. Curried lentils are great added to bread such as a chapati with diced tomatoes and mint leaves added to the top for garnish. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a9\/Make-Curried-Lentils-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Curried-Lentils-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a9\/Make-Curried-Lentils-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-Curried-Lentils-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"} Wrap curried lentils (cooled) inside a burrito wrapper for a tasty lunch. Eat as a dip with corn chips, toast fingers or celery sticks.

text:
Rinse the lentils under running water. It's easiest if you do this in a colander or sieve. Remove any small stones or debris. Pour the stock or water into a large saucepan or pot. Add the lentils and salt. Bring to a boil. Sauté the onions in the olive oil in a frying pan. Add the curry and garlic powder (or finely chopped garlic). Cook until the onions become tender and then add them to the boiling lentils. Keep cooking the lentils for another hour or so. More liquid can be added as needed, either more stock or water (add 1/2 cup at a time and add more if needed). Remove from the heat. The lentils will be a more yellow or golden color owing to the curry. Serve. The curried lentils can be served as they are as part of a side accompaniment or even as a curried lentil mains for a vegetarian. Curried lentils are great added to bread such as a chapati with diced tomatoes and mint leaves added to the top for garnish. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a9\/Make-Curried-Lentils-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Curried-Lentils-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a9\/Make-Curried-Lentils-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-Curried-Lentils-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

\n<\/p>
